title: Beads TUI - Interactive terminal UI for bd
description:
Build a complete interactive TUI for beads (bd) using Python + Textual framework.

## Architecture
- beads_tui/ package with __main__.py entry point (python -m beads_tui)
- bd_client.py: subprocess wrapper around bd CLI using --json flag
- models.py: dataclasses for Issue, Comment, etc.
- app.py: main Textual App class
- screens/: Textual screens (main list, detail, create form)
- widgets/: custom widgets (issue table, filter bar, pickers)
- styles/app.tcss: CSS theme

## Features Required
1. Main list view: DataTable with all issues, color-coded by priority & status
2. Detail panel: full issue details in side panel or overlay screen
3. Inline editing: change priority (p), status (s), assignee (a), title (e)
4. Create form: modal form to create new issues (c)
5. Search/filter: text search + filter by status/priority/type
6. Comments: view and add comments on issues
7. Labels: view and manage labels
8. Close/reopen issues
9. Live reload: periodic polling with diff-based updates (no flicker)
10. Beautiful CSS theme with color-coded priorities and statuses
11. Full keyboard navigation with help overlay (?)
12. Status bar showing db stats and active filters

## Dependencies
- textual (only external dep)
- stdlib: subprocess, json, dataclasses, asyncio, pathlib

## bd CLI commands to wrap
- bd list --json
- bd show <id> --json
- bd update <id> (--title, --status, --priority, --assignee, --description, etc.)
- bd create (--title, --description, --priority, --type, --assignee, --labels)
- bd close <id> / bd reopen <id>
- bd search <query> --json
- bd comments <id> --json / bd comments add <id> 'text'
- bd label add/remove <id> <label>
- bd status --json

## Quality Requirements
- Zero flicker: use Textual reactive attributes and worker threads
- Live reload: timer-based polling every 2-3 seconds, only update changed data
- Beautiful: rich color theme, clean layout, visual hierarchy
- Easy to use: intuitive keybindings, contextual help
- Minimal deps: only textual + stdlib
close_reason: MVP complete. All child tickets closed.

title: BD client: Python subprocess wrapper with JSON parsing
description:
Create beads_tui/bd_client.py — a thin async wrapper around the bd CLI.

## Deliverables
A BdClient class that shells out to bd with --json and parses results. Methods:
- list_issues(status, priority, type, assignee, limit, sort) -> list[Issue]
- show_issue(id) -> Issue
- search_issues(query, status, priority) -> list[Issue]
- create_issue(title, description, priority, type, assignee, labels) -> str (id)
- update_issue(id, **fields) -> None
- close_issue(id, reason) -> None
- reopen_issue(id) -> None
- list_comments(id) -> list[Comment]
- add_comment(id, text) -> None
- add_label(id, label) -> None
- remove_label(id, label) -> None
- get_status() -> dict (db stats)

## Data models (beads_tui/models.py)
Dataclasses: Issue, Comment — matching bd --json output fields. Use stdlib dataclasses only.

## Implementation
- Use asyncio.create_subprocess_exec for non-blocking calls
- Parse JSON output, map to dataclasses
- Handle errors gracefully (bd not found, db not initialized)
- Auto-discover bd binary path (check PATH, ~/.local/bin/bd)

## Acceptance
- All methods work against a real bd database
- Errors return meaningful exceptions, not raw subprocess failures
close_reason: Merged to main. 12 async methods, all tested against live bd database.

title: Integration test (updated)
Fix filter bar CSS: Select text invisible, buttons misaligned, modal clipped
description:
Root cause: app.tcss CSS_PATH rules override FilterBar DEFAULT_CSS. Global Button/Select styles clobber local overrides.

Issues:
1. Priority & Type Select widgets show NO TEXT - global 'Select { border: solid }' in app.tcss wins over 'FilterBar Select { border: none }' in DEFAULT_CSS. Border consumes 2 of 3 height cells.
2. Clear button not vertically centered - global 'Button { margin: 1 1 0 0 }' wins over FilterBar override.
3. Status filter button shorter - same global margin issue.
4. StatusFilterModal Apply/Cancel buttons cut off - modal width 40 too small for 4 buttons with global min-width 12.

Fix: Add FilterBar and StatusFilterModal specific overrides IN app.tcss (not DEFAULT_CSS) so they take proper priority.
close_reason: Fixed: moved CSS overrides to app.tcss for proper CSS_PATH priority
